Quality Assurance Home

XMF Data Files

A number of Mobile XMF files are provided for testing and validating the ME3000. Play these files on your target device and compare the output with the same file played using "play_song.exe" on a Windows PC.

See also the "Bad XMF Files".

These files are only for testing purposes only and may not be redistributed.
Files in "xmf/qa" Description
2RegionTest.mxmf Play note with slow vibrato using Instrument articulation. Then play note with fast vibrato using an overriding region articulation. Then play both together.
AllTypesTest.mxmf Play notes using ME1000, ME2000 and ME3000 style voices.
AnyOneHome.mxmf Melody played on bell with door knocking sounds in background.
BankMelDrumSwap.mxmf Four notes played on channels 9,10,11,12. One should hear "drum, piano, drum, drum". Normal instruments assignments are swapped by using GM2 bank selects 120 and 121.
carumba.mxmf Cartoon character voice over percussion track.
charge.mxmf Trumpet fanfare and voice yelling "charge".
charge_alaw.mxmf Trumpet fanfare and voice yelling "charge". Voice sample is compressed using ALaw.
DrumKitFallThroughTest.mxmf Drum notes that do not all have corresponding regions. Notes that do not match a regions should be silent. Should hear only four widely spaced drum sounds.
DrumKitTest2.mxmf Miscellaneous drum sounds.
DrumPitch.mxmf Test assignment of pitch based on region and wave information, not note index. Listener should hear four bell sounds at two pitches, "high, high, low, high".
EnvelopeDelay.mxmf Two notes started together. One note has volume envelope delay of 145, 750 and 24315 msec.
EnvelopeDAHDSR.mxmf Envelope with increasing values for all segments, DAHDSR. A short sound marks the NoteOn time.
EnvelopeHold.mxmf Envelope with short, medium and extremely long hold time.
Key_to_Pitch.mxmf Plays 3 sequences with four notes 12 keys apart. The first sequence use Key to Pitch scaling of 20 cents per key. Then 60 cents, then 90 cents. The sequence will expand each time.
LFOTest1 Play a guitar note with vibrato using MOD LFO. Play note with MOD LFO delayed. Play note with vibrato using Vibrato LFO. Play note with Vibrato LFO delayed.
ModEnvToPitch.mxmf Play three notes with increasingly large upward pitch contour. Play fourth note with downward pitch contour.
MOD_LFO_CC1_to_Pitch.mxmf Play three notes with increasing pitch modulation. Depth of modulation is swept from zero to maximum then back to zero using Control Change #1 commands. Modulation source is 1 Hz MOD LFO.
MOD_LFO_CPress_to_Pitch.mxmf Play three notes with increasing pitch modulation. Depth of modulation is swept from zero to maximum then back to zero using Channel Pressure. Modulation source is 1 Hz MOD LFO.
TalkinReggae.mxmf Reggae ringtone with spoken words "Reggae" and "Jammin'".
Tuning.mxmf Three notes with the same index that increase in output pitch using Tuning articulation.
VelocityMatch.mxmf Test matching of notes to regions using velocity range. Listener should hear low pitched "la" then bell, medium pitched "la" then bell, then high pitched "la" then bell.
Vib_LFO_CC1_to_Pitch.mxmf Play three notes with increasing pitch modulation. Depth of modulation is swept from zero to maximum then back to zero using Control Change #1 commands. Modulation source is 5 Hz Vibrato LFO.
Vib_LFO_CPress_to_Pitch.mxmf Play three notes with increasing pitch modulation. Depth of modulation is swept from zero to maximum then back to zero using Channel Pressure. Modulation source is 5 Hz Vibrato LFO.
VoiceLa.mxmf Organ chord followed by ascending series of four vocal notes singing "la".
Vol_Env_Sustain2.mxmf Three notes with increasing sustain level.

These files are only for testing purposes only and may not be redistributed.
